WorkItem.Description: Enchanting any of my two equipped weapons (MH or OH) with Executioner is giving a greater value than 120 to my total ArP rating, its adding about 154 from MH (34 extra mysterious points) or 135 from OH (15 extra over).

Comments.Message:
1) http://rawr.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=PostingGuidelines
2) What Model
3) Attach the Character File
4) It's Rawr, not RAWR
my bad, model: Rawr.DPSWarr, char file attached

Ok, now that I have that info, I think I replicated the issue. See the attached image.

I should mention that this issue is ENTIRELY COSMETIC. The calculations are all working fine, its just the display showing the wrong ArP on the panel. The Tooltips show you the correct values.

The Pane *should* be showing your 1283 + ((Min(1400-1283,120)) * (15/60)) = ~1313 (Base + average proc value as limited by the cap). I will correct the pane shortly.

On another note, to all users, when you make your files, SET UP YOUR BUFFS. Rawr telling you your DPS when unbuffed is about as useful as not using Rawr at all. At least set up a few basics ones you know you always raid with.

ah yes the pane shows the correct value, but not the stats tab, i could live with this however looks like the core engine of the program looks at the stats tab, thus throwing off my gear/gem comparisions and displaying to replace that 3% overcap of ArP gems to str/other gems when im already 100% ArP proc'd and fine with the gems i got, grr what a pain.

Dannos, I think you missed some important parts of Jothay's response. I'll reiterate:

"I should mention that this issue is ENTIRELY COSMETIC. The calculations are all working fine, its just the display showing the wrong ArP on the panel. The Tooltips show you the correct values."

and without repeating what i mentioned...rawr is more of pain then a reliable tool to me this way.  when Jothay said he will correct the pane, not sure what that means...the stats tab will be fixed for the next release?

The Pane, meaning the Stats Pane, where you are seeing the misprinted extra ArP, is what I will be correcting. The Back End, where calculations are actually being done, is working correctly, meaning it's making the correct gear decisions.
